content: Configuration commands for Arista EOS devices.
Configure ip address 192.168.1.1/32 on interface ethernet 1

enable
configure terminal
interface ethernet 1
ip address 192.168.1.1/32
Configure MTU 5000 on interface ethernet 1

enable
configure terminal
interface ethernet 1
mtu 5000
Configure load interval as 5 sec on interface ethernet1

enable
configure terminal
interface ethernet1
load-interval 5
Configure BGP with ASN 500, neighbor as 192.168.1.1, and neighbor ASN as 1000

enable
configure terminal
router bgp 500
neighbor 192.168.1.1 remote-as 1000
Add new user with name arista and password as arista

enable
configure terminal
username arista secret arista
Change the hostname as DLFW1

enable
configure terminal
hostname DLFW1
Configure OSPF 1 with router ID as 10.10.10.10, area ID as 0.0.0.0, range as 192.168.0.0/24, network as 10.0.0.0/24on interface ethernet 1

enable
configure terminal
router ospf 1
router-id 10.10.10.10
area 0.0.0.0 range 192.168.0.0/24
network 10.0.0.0/24 area 0.0.0.0
exit
interface ethernet 1
ip ospf area 0.0.0.0
Add a static route for ip address 10.10.1.1/24 from next hop as Vlan50

enable
configure terminal
ip route 10.10.1.1/24 Vlan50
Update the description as 'This is test description' on interface ethernet1

enable
configure terminal
interface ethernet1
description This is a test description
Create patch panel name as arsita, connector1 interface as ethernt10, On connector2 connection type as BGP, VPWS name as test-vpws, PW name as test-pw and VPWS type as vlan

enable
configure terminal
patch panel
patch arista
connector 1 interface ethernet 10
connector 2 pseudowire bgp vpws test-vpws pseudowire test-pw
Configure HTTP with port 80 and HTTPS with port 443

enable
configure terminal
management http
protocol http port 80 

management http
protocol https port 443
Configure interface Ethernet1 with rate as 1Gbps full duplex

enable
configure terminal
interface Ethernet1
speed forced 1000full
Configure a schedule job for show tech-support command with name tech-suuport, start at 12:00:00, interval 120 min, max log files 100 and log location as flash:schedule/tech-support/

enable
configure terminal
schedule tech-support at 12:00:00 interval 120 max-log-files 100 loglocation flash:schedule/tech-support/ command show tech-support
Create a vlan 1000 with name as arista

enable
configure terminal
vlan 1000
ame arsita
Configure user password complexity of length 20

enable
configure terminal
management security
password minimum length 20
Configure user password complexity of length 20

enable
configure terminal
management security
password minimum length 20
Configure a switch with source interface as Management1, Logging VRF as MGMT and syslog server ip as 192,168.1.1 514

enable
configure terminal
logging vrf MGMT source-interface Management1
logging vrf MGMT host 192.168.1.1 514
configure a name-server 9.8.8.8 in vrf default

enable
configure terminal
ip name-server vrf default 9.9.9.9
Enable management api for http commands

enable
configure terminal
management api http-commands
vrf default
Configure NTP server with ip 8.7.7.7

enable
configure terminal
ntp server 8.7.7.7
vrf default
Configure login banner on the switch

enable
configure terminal
banner login
This is a sample login banner. EOF
Configure interface ethernet1 as trunk port

enable
configure terminal
interface ethernet1
switchport mode trunk
Configure VARP on an arista switch

enable
configure terminal
ip virtual-router mac-address 001c.7300.0999
interface vlan 50
ip address 10.10.4.1/24
ip virtual-router address 10.10.4.10
interface vlan 70
ip address 10.24.4.17/24
ip virtual-router address 10.24.4.1
exit
Configure SVI on arista switch

enable
configure terminal
interface vlan 10
ip address 10.0.0.2/24
ip virtual-router address 10.0.0.6
exit
Configure boot security unencrypted password as arista.

enable
configure terminal
boot secret 0 arista
Configure a name-server 192.168.10.10 on vlan 1197.

enable
configure terminal
interface vlan 1197
ip name-server 192.168.10.10
Configure DHCP server 192.168.10.0/24 with 2 days lease time.

enable
configure terminal
dhcp server
lease time ipv4 2 days 0 hours 0 minutes
subnet 192.168.10.0/24
Configuration commands for Arista EOS devices.
Configure switch group on an arista switch

enable
configure terminal
management xmpp
switch-group abc@test.com
Configure and create a profile that allows forwarding of all frames

enable
configure terminal
forwarding profile abc
isis forward
macsec tagged forward
pause untagged forward
exit
CConfigure a layer2 sub interface ethernet1.1 with encapsulation dot1q vlan 100 on arista switch

enable
configure terminal
interface et1
no switchport
interface et1.1
encapsulation dot1q vlan 100
vlan id 200
Configure BFD on interface Ethernet3 with echo enabled and 10000 milliseconds interval and 4 packets that must be missed in succession before BFD declares the session to be down.

enable
configure terminal
interface Ethernet3
bfd authentication mode disabled
bfd echo
bfd interval 10000 min-rx 10000 multiplier 4
Enable LLDP transmit and receive on interface ethernet 3

enable
configure terminal
interface Ethernet3
lldp receive
lldp transmit
Add interface ethernet 7 to channel group 7 with static link aggregation.

enable
configure terminal
interface Ethernet7
channel-group 7 mode on
Add interface ethernet 7 to channel group 7 with LACP enabled.

enable
configure terminal
interface Ethernet7
channel-group 7 mode active
Configure multi agent routing model on device.

enable
configure terminal
service routing protocols model multi-agent
Configure ribd routing protcol.

enable
configure terminal
service routing protocols model ribd
Configure rip protocol on an arista switch

enable
configure terminal
router rip
network 192.168.1.0/24
network 10.0.0.0/8
exit
